title: Showers expected after 2.00 p.m. today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern, and Uva provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya district after 2.00 p.m. today (28).

title: ‘Where were they during LTTE terror?’: Ex-Navy Chief slams UK sanctions
byline: Former Navy Commander, Admiral of the Fleet Wasantha Karannagoda has responded to the sanctions imposed by the UK government against him and several others alleging them of widespread human rights violations during Sri Lanka’s military operations against the LTTE.

title: Govt. should not repeat past mistakes – Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa expressed his disapproval of the decision made by the Mahinda Rajapaksa government to remove Shirani Bandaranayake from the position of Chief Justice.

title: 27 arrested during protest in front of Health Ministry
byline: Police have arrested twenty seven individuals including members of the Inter-University Students Federation (IUSF) for holding a protest march violating a court order, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Gammanpila accuses US Ambassador of editing Sri Lanka’s statement on UK sanctions
byline: Leader of ‘Pivithuru Hela Urumaya’ Udaya Gammanpila alleges that US Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung has omitted certain words and edited the statement issued by Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs in response to the sanctions imposed by the UK government on former military chiefs.

title: King Charles III briefly hospitalized for observation following side effects from cancer treatment
byline: King Charles III was briefly hospitalized for observation on Thursday after experiencing “temporary side effects’’ related to a scheduled cancer treatment, Buckingham Palace said in a statement.

title: Wildlife census report to be released today
byline: The report on the recently conducted census of wild animals responsible for crop damage is scheduled to be released today (28).

title: India officially announces PM Modi’s Sri Lanka visit
byline: The Ministry of External Affairs of India has issued an official statement outlining Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Thailand and Sri Lanka next week.

title: Sri Lanka’s economy still vulnerable, sustaining reform momentum critical - IMF
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) says that the economic recovery is gaining momentum in Sri Lanka and that yet, the economy still remains vulnerable, making it critical that the reform momentum be sustained to ensure that macroeconomic stability and debt sustainability are durably achieved.

title: NTC Chairman resigns, becoming third official to quit under Minister Bimal
byline: The Chairman of the National Transport Commission (NTC), Dr. Bandura Dileepa Vitharana has tendered his resignation today (28).

title: Strong earthquake in central Myanmar, panic in Bangkok
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 6.9 struck Myanmar, the German Research Centre for Geosciences (GFZ) said on Friday, while hundreds of people poured out of buildings in the Thai capital Bangkok after the tremors.

title: Court to decide on ex-Minister Prasanna Ranaweera’s plea against arrest
byline: The Court of Appeal has announced that a decision on whether to proceed with former Minister Prasanna Ranaweera’s petition seeking an order to prevent his arrest will be delivered on April 28, 2025.
